This module implements operations on HDRimages and PFM files

Imports

colors

Types

HdrImage = object
  width*, height*: int       ## `width` (int) and `height` (int) number of columns and rows of the matrix of colors
  pixels*: seq[colors.Color] ## `pixels` (seq of Color type): the matrix of colors represented by a 1D array
A High-Dynamic-Range 2D image type 
InvalidPfmFileFormat = object of CatchableError

Procs

proc averageLuminosity(img: HdrImage; delta = 1e-10): float32 {....raises: [],
    tags: [].}

Computes average luminosity of an image.

The delta parameter is to take account of numerical problems for underilluminated pixels, default is set to 10e-10.

proc clampImage(img: var HdrImage) {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Adjusts the color levels of the brightest pixels in the image 
proc getPixel(img: HdrImage; x, y: int): colors.Color {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Returns Color in pixel of coordinates (x,y) 
proc newHDRImage(width, height: int): HdrImage {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Creates an empty black image (the Color fields are set to 0 by default) 
proc normalizeImage(img: var HdrImage; factor: float32;
                    luminosity = averageLuminosity(img)) {....raises: [], tags: [].}

Normalizes image for a given luminosity.

Luminosity parameter can be set by user, if the field is empty, default is set to averageLuminosity() value.

proc parseEndianness(line: string): Endianness {....raises: [InvalidPfmFileFormat],
    tags: [].}

Outputs the HDRimage byte endiannes from PFM file format.

Raises InvalidPfmFileFormat error if the endianess specification is not valid

proc parseImgSize(line: string): tuple

Outputs the HDRimage size (width and height) from PFM file format.

Raises InvalidPfmFileFormat Error if the size specifications are not valid

proc pixelOffset(img: HdrImage; x, y: int): int {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Calculates indices in the image array 
proc readPfmImage(stream: Stream): HdrImage {.
    ...raises: [IOError, OSError, InvalidPfmFileFormat], tags: [ReadIOEffect].}

Reads data from PFM file format.

The stream parameter must be a I/O stream. Raises InvalidPfmFileFormat error if magic is not valid or other data is not readable/enough.

proc setPixel(img: var HdrImage; x, y: int; newColor: colors.Color) {.
    ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Sets Color in pixel of coordinates (x,y) 
proc validCoordinates(img: HdrImage; x, y: int): bool {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Tests if image coordinates are in right range 
proc writeLdrImage(img: HdrImage; outputPath: string; gamma = 1.0) {.
    ...raises: [PixieError], tags: [WriteIOEffect].}

Saves the image in a LDR format.

Before calling this function, you should apply a tone-mapping algorithm to the image and be sure that the R, G, and B values of the colors in the image are all in the range [0, 1]. Use normalizeImageand clampImage to do this.

proc writePfmImage(img: HdrImage; stream: Stream; endianness = littleEndian) {.
    ...raises: [IOError, OSError], tags: [WriteIOEffect].}

Writes the image in PFM file format.

The stream parameter must be a I/O stream. The parameter endianness specifies the byte endianness to be used in the file, default is set to little endian.
